author: Creg Stephenson | cstephenson@al.com
title: SECond Look: Will Kirby Smart replace Steve Spurrier at South Carolina?
text:
Comments 
The Las Vegas oddsmakers have installed Alabama defensive coordinator Kirby Smart as the favorite to be the next head football coach at South Carolina following the resignation of Steve Spurrier. 
In the latest edition of AL.com's SECond Look, Creg Stephenson and Mark Heim say that's more than just idle chatter. 
"We always kind of thought Kirby Smart was holding out for one of two jobs — Georgia, his alma mater, or Alabama, where he's been Nick Saban's right-hand man for more than a decade including the NFL — but it doesn't look like either one of those are going to come open," Stephenson said. "South Carolina is open now, and that's a program that doesn't have an obvious heir apparent." 
Said Heim, "One thing he's going to have to do (if he gets the South Carolina job), that Steve Spurrier didn't like to do if you listened to his press conference — recruit." 
Would Kirby Smart be a good fit at South Carolina? Watch the latest edition of SECond Look to find out.
